description:
Christian teaching describes the soul's journey from physical death through judgment to eternal
                destination - Heaven (communion with God), Purgatory (purification), or Hell (separation from God).
                This journey culminates in bodily resurrection and final judgment at Christ's return.
name: Christian Mythology
connections: Olam Ha-Ba - The World to Come in Jewish eschatology
Sheol - Hebrew underworld, realm of the dead
Gehenna - Place of purification and punishment
Techiyat HaMetim - The resurrection of the dead
Pleroma - The divine fullness as ultimate destination
Gnosis - Knowledge leading to spiritual liberation
Archons - Rulers of material realms the soul must pass
Egyptian Duat - The underworld journey and judgment
Greek Underworld - Hades, Tartarus, and Elysium
Islamic Akhirah - Judgment Day, Jannah, and Jahannam
Norse Hel - Realm of the dead, Valhalla for the brave

description:
The Genesis creation narrative reveals God speaking the universe into existence through His word,
                bringing order from chaos, culminating in humanity made in the divine image. A six-day work followed
                by sacred rest, establishing the pattern for all creation.
name: Christian Mythology
connections: Bereshit - Genesis in the Hebrew tradition
Tzimtzum - Kabbalistic divine contraction for creation
Sefirot - Divine emanations in creation process
Shabbat - The sacred seventh day of rest
Demiurge - The creator deity of the material world
Apocryphon of John - Gnostic creation narrative
Sophia - Wisdom's role in creation and fall
Enuma Elish - Babylonian creation epic with parallels
Egyptian Creation - Atum and the primordial waters
Hindu Creation - Brahma's cosmic egg, Purusha hymn
Norse Creation - Ginnungagap, ice and fire, Ymir

description: Grace (from Latin gratia, Greek charis) is the fundamental principle of God's dealings with humanity in Christian theology. It represents God's free and unmerited favor‚ÄîHis kindness toward those who deserve punishment, His love toward those who are unlovely, His mercy toward those who are guilty. Grace is not something God owes to humanity; it flows from His own character as a loving, compassionate, and merciful God.
name: Christian Cosmology
connections: Chesed - Lovingkindness, covenant faithfulness
Rachamim - Divine compassion and mercy
Teshuvah - Repentance enabling return to God
Yom Kippur - Day of Atonement and forgiveness
Divine Spark - Inner light awaiting awakening
Gnosis - Salvific knowledge as gift
Pleroma - Return to divine fullness
Hindu Prasada - Divine grace and blessing
Buddhist Karuna - Universal compassion
Islamic Rahma - Divine mercy and compassion
Sikh Nadar - Divine grace enabling liberation

description: The eternal dwelling place of God where the redeemed experience perfect joy, worship, and communion in the divine presence forever.
name: Christian Cosmology
connections: Olam Ha-Ba - The World to Come
Gan Eden - Garden of Eden / Paradise
Shekinah - Divine presence dwelling
Ezekiel's Vision - Throne of God imagery
Pleroma - Divine fullness, heavenly realm
Aeons - Celestial beings in divine realm
Return to Light - Soul's ascent to divine
Apocalypse of Paul - Heavenly journey
Jannah (Islamic) - Paradise gardens
Valhalla (Norse) - Hall of the slain
Elysium (Greek) - Fields of the blessed
Svarga (Hindu) - Celestial paradise

description: The incarnation (from Latin incarnatio, "to make flesh") is the Christian doctrine that God the Son, the second person of the Trinity, took on human nature and became a human being in Jesus Christ. This is expressed in the profound declaration of the Gospel of John: "The Word became flesh and dwelt among us."
name: Christian Cosmology
connections: Mashiach - The awaited Messiah figure
Shekinah - Divine presence dwelling among humanity
Immanuel - "God with us" from Isaiah's prophecy
Isaiah's Servant - The suffering servant prophecies
Docetism - Belief Christ only appeared human (rejected)
Aeons - Divine emanations descending to earth
Gospel of Philip - Gnostic views on Christ's nature
Hindu Avatars - Divine incarnations, especially Krishna
Bodhisattvas - Enlightened beings taking form to help others
Egyptian Horus - Divine child born of Isis
Divine Births - Greek heroes with divine parentage

description: The resurrection of Jesus Christ is the cornerstone of Christian faith. Three days after His crucifixion and burial, Jesus rose bodily from the dead, conquering death and vindicating His claims to be the Son of God. The tomb was found empty, the grave clothes left behind, and Jesus appeared alive to numerous witnesses over forty days‚Äîto Mary Magdalene, to the disciples, to more than five hundred people at once.
name: Christian Cosmology
connections: Techiyat HaMetim - Resurrection of the dead
Valley of Dry Bones - Ezekiel 37 vision
Daniel's Prophecy - "Many shall awake"
Olam Ha-Ba - World to come
Treatise on Resurrection - Gnostic text
Return to Pleroma - Spiritual resurrection
Soul's Ascent - Rising to divine realm
Gospel of Philip - Resurrection teachings
Osiris (Egyptian) - Dying and rising god
Dionysus (Greek) - Death and rebirth
Inanna (Sumerian) - Descent and return
Frashegird (Zoroastrian) - Bodily resurrection

description: Christian theology teaches that all humanity stands in need of salvation because of sin. Since the fall of Adam and Eve in the Garden of Eden, humanity has been separated from God by sin, which the Bible describes as both inherited guilt (original sin) and personal transgressions. Sin results in spiritual death and separation from God's presence, making salvation necessary for restoration.
name: Christian Cosmology
connections: Teshuvah - Repentance and return to God
Kippur - Day of Atonement traditions
Brit - Covenant relationship with God
Suffering Servant - Isaiah 53 prophecy
Gnosis - Salvation through knowledge
Sophia's Redemption - Divine wisdom restored
Return to Pleroma - Soul's liberation
Archon Liberation - Freedom from cosmic powers
Moksha (Hindu) - Liberation from cycle
Nirvana (Buddhist) - Liberation from suffering
Frashokereti (Zoroastrian) - Final renovation
Ma'at (Egyptian) - Judgment and eternal life

name: The Holy
connections: Shema - "Hear O Israel, the Lord is One"
Shekinah - Divine presence, Spirit parallel
Chokhmah - Personified Wisdom (Logos parallel)
Memra - Aramaic "Word" concept
Pleroma - Divine fullness and emanations
Sophia - Divine feminine wisdom figure
Barbelo - First emanation concept
Aeons - Divine beings structure
Trimurti (Hindu) - Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva triad
Egyptian Triads - Divine family groupings
Greek Theogony - Divine relationships
Triple Goddess (Celtic) - Threefold divine
description: Also known as The Holy Trinity.
